greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Version of sexagesimal expansion of sine of one degree given by the Persian mathematician Al-Kashi in the 15th Century.
comment: The fifteenth century persian mathematician Jamshid Al-Kashi was the first to calculate the value of sine of one degree correct to ten sexagesimal places (17 decimal digits) in his Risala al-Watar wa'l Jaib.
link: Mohammad K. Azarian, A Study of Risala al-Watar wa'l Jaib ("The Treatise on the Chord and Sine"), Forum Geometricorum, Volume 15 (2015) 229-242. Mathematical Reviews, MR 3418854 (Reviewed), Zentralblatt MATH, Zbl 1328.01015.
results.author: _Mohammad K. Azarian_, Dec 28 2016
